algorithmRules.overview: Recommendation system for 'For You' feed; open-sourced code analyzed. Optimizes for predicted engagement via ML models; processes billions of posts daily.
algorithmRules.featureHydration: ~6000 features: user behavior, post content, graph connections (SimClusters, RealGraph), real-time signals.

scoring.weights: Dynamic, learned via ML; personalized; A/B tested. No fixed percentages.
scoring.pipeline: NAVI ranker, reranking, heuristics, low-signal scoring.

algorithmRules.selection: Sort by scores, apply diversity, mix with ads/prompts.
keyRulesConditions: Prioritize engagement: Replies 13.5-27x > likes (0.5-1x); profile clicks 12-24x.
Early momentum: First hour traction 2-3x reach.
Media boost: Images/videos prioritized; video-first platform.
Avoid external links: Reduce reach if users leave app.
No toxicity/spam: Attacks, repetition, offensive terms (80% deboost) lead to downranking/shadowbans.
Personalization: Stay in SimClusters (niche consistency); RealGraph bonds.
Account factors: Verified/TweepCred boost (+17+ score); follower/following ratio ≤60%; clean from bots.
Conversation: Reply to engage; encourage replies/reposts.
Throttling: No early engagement → buried; negative signals/reports tank reach.
Trends/timing: Tie to trends; post during audience activity; relevance drops 50% every 6h.
Viral drivers: High predictions, pass filters, media, timely.
algorithmRules.updates2025: Stricter toxicity detection for advertiser safety; favors focused topics, videos, influencer tags; penalizes deleted posts, generic memes.

toxicity.overview: Toxicity encompasses abusive, hateful, or harmful content that targets individuals or groups, degrading platform discourse. Detected via ML models integrated into safety filters (e.g., Grok-powered postScore), with enforcement reducing visibility by up to 80% or leading to removal/suspension. Focuses on context, severity, and protected categories to balance free expression.

definitions.hatefulConduct: Abuse targeting perceived membership in protected categories (race, ethnicity, national origin, caste, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, religious affiliation, age, disability, serious disease) motivated by hatred, prejudice, or intolerance.
definitions.targetedHarassment: Malicious, unreciprocated targeting via mentions, tags, or dedicated accounts to humiliate/degrade, including multiple rapid malicious posts/replies.
definitions.violentEventDenial: Denying verified mass murders/casualty events (e.g., Holocaust, school shootings) as hoaxes with abusive context.
definitions.incitement: Encouraging fear, stereotypes, harassment, or discrimination against protected groups (e.g., 'all [group] are terrorists'; calls to 'grab [symbol] and post pics').
definitions.slursAndTropes: Repeated use of slurs, tropes, or degrading stereotypes in harassing contexts.
definitions.dehumanization: Portraying groups as subhuman based on protected traits.
definitions.unwantedSexualContent: Unsolicited sexualization, objectification, or adult media without consent.
definitions.insults: Profanity or insults targeting individuals (not every offensive term).
definitions.hatefulImagery: Symbols/logos (e.g., Nazi swastika), altered images (e.g., animalistic features on groups), or Holocaust references used to harass.
definitions.hatefulProfile: Abusive usernames, bios, or profile/header images/symbols promoting hate.

violationTypes: Content forms (posts, DMs, live video, bios, profiles)
References to violence/events (e.g., genocides for harassment)
Incitement scales (fear, harassment, discrimination; excludes non-discriminatory protests)
examples: Hateful reference: Depicting lynchings to target ethnicity.
Slurs: Repeated racist tropes in replies.
Dehumanization: Calling a group 'animals' based on religion.
Imagery: Swastika in header; image with yellow Star of David on group.
Harassment: Dedicated account tagging victim with insults.
Sexual: Unsolicited body-shaming or nudes in DMs.
nonViolations: Contextual/consensual use (e.g., reclaimed slurs within group).

methods: NLP and ML models: BERT-based classifiers for text toxicity; ensemble methods like Random Forest (85-91% accuracy), SVM, XGBoost, LSTM (up to 91% accuracy).
Context-aware: Considers platform culture, chat type (global/team/private), user history, relationships; distinguishes slang/strategy from harm.
Multi-modal: Analyzes text, images (e.g., symbol detection), videos; TF-IDF for key terms, wordclouds for frequent toxic phrases.
Datasets: Jigsaw Toxicity (binary/multi-class labels: toxic, severe toxic, obscene, threat, insult, identity hate); Civil Comments; hate speech benchmarks.
Advanced 2025: LLMs (e.g., ToxBuster) for self-augmentation, explanation; XAI for interpretable decisions; real-time streaming (e.g., Confluent/Databricks) for evolving slang.
Thresholds: Toxicity scores >0.5 trigger filters; min relevancy 0.18 for semantic search; accuracy targets 87%+ via optimized gradients.
Integration: Part of ~6000 features in algo; Grok safety scoring; proactive (pre-post warnings) vs. reactive (reports).
challenges: Bias: Unintended in training data; mitigated via diverse datasets, XAI explainability.
Scalability: Billions of posts; real-time retraining to counter drift.
False positives: Context-dependent (e.g., in-game trash talk).

enforcement.severityBased: Mild/isolated: Downrank replies (reduce visibility in search/recommendations/timelines). Moderate/repetitive: Restrict engagements (likes/reposts/quotes). Severe/dedicated: Post removal, read-only mode, account suspension.
actions: Visibility filters: Exclude from trends/notifications/ads; limit to author profile.
Account penalties: Temporary lock, permanent ban for evasion/history.
Human-AI hybrid: Reports trigger review; target input for edge cases; appeals via form.
enforcement.metrics: Engagement drop (80% deboost for toxic); advertiser safety (stricter 2025 filters); user retention via reduced exposure.
